net.sf.gogui.gtp
Class GtpClientBase

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.gogui.gtp.GtpClientBase
Direct Known Subclasses:
GtpClient, GuiGtpClient
public abstract class GtpClientBase
extends java.lang.Object

Interface to a Go program that uses GTP. This class implements most of the functionality of a connection to a GTP command apart from how commands are actually sent to the program. Subclasses need to implement the abstract function send() and a few functions related to querying and using the ability to interrupt commands.

protected java.lang.String m_name
Constructor Detail

GtpClientBase

public GtpClientBase()
Method Detail

close

public abstract void close()
Close output connection. Should do nothing if the concrete class does not communicate through streams.

getCommandBoardsize

public java.lang.String getCommandBoardsize(int size)
Get command for setting the board size. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Returns:
The boardsize command for GTP version 2 programs, otherwise null.

getCommandClearBoard

public java.lang.String getCommandClearBoard(int size)
Get command for starting a new game. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Returns:
The boardsize command for GTP version 1 programs, otherwise the clear_board command.

getCommandGenmove

public java.lang.String getCommandGenmove(GoColor color)
Get command for generating a move. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Parameters:
color - GoColor::BLACK or GoColor::WHITE
Returns:
The right command depending on the GTP version.

getCommandPlay

public java.lang.String getCommandPlay(Move move)
Get command for playing a move. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Returns:
The right command depending on the GTP version.

getCpuTime

public double getCpuTime()
                  throws GtpError
Send cputime command and convert the result to double.

Throws:
GtpError - if command fails or does not return a floating point number.

getLabel

public java.lang.String getLabel()
Get program name or "Unknown Program" if unknown. If queryName() was not called or the name command failed, the string "Unknown Program" is returned.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get program name. If queryName() was not called or the name command failed, the string "Unknown Program" is returned.

getProtocolVersion

public int getProtocolVersion()
Get protocol version. You have to call queryProtocolVersion() first, otherwise this method will always return 2.

getSupportedCommands

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSupportedCommands()
Get the supported commands. Note: call querySupportedCommands() first.

Returns:
A vector of strings with the supported commands.

isProgramDead

public boolean isProgramDead()
Is the program in a state, that all subsequent commands will fail. Returns false, but can be reimplemented in a subclass.

isSupported

public boolean isSupported(java.lang.String command)
Check if a command is supported. Note: call querySupportedCommands() first.

isCpuTimeSupported

public boolean isCpuTimeSupported()
Check if cputime command is supported. Note: call querySupportedCommands() first.

isGenmoveSupported

public boolean isGenmoveSupported()
Check if a genmove command is supported. If list_commands is not supported, it is assumed that genmove is supported. Note: call querySupportedCommands() first.

isInterruptSupported

public boolean isInterruptSupported()
Check if interrupting a command is supported. Interrupting can supported by ANSI C signals or the special comment line "# interrupt" as described in the GoGui documentation chapter "Interrupting commands". Note: call queryInterruptSupport() first.

queryInterruptSupport

public void queryInterruptSupport()
Query if interrupting is supported.

See Also:
isInterruptSupported()

queryName

public void queryName()
Queries the name.

See Also:
getName()

queryProtocolVersion

public void queryProtocolVersion()
Query the protocol version. Assumes version 2 if the protocol_version command is not available, fails, or returns a version greater 2.

See Also:
getProtocolVersion()

querySupportedCommands

public void querySupportedCommands()
                            throws GtpError
Query the supported commands.

Throws:
GtpError
See Also:
getSupportedCommands(), isSupported(java.lang.String)

queryVersion

public java.lang.String queryVersion()
Queries the program version.

Returns:
The version or an empty string if the version command fails.

send

public abstract java.lang.String send(java.lang.String command)
                               throws GtpError
Send a command.

Returns:
The response text of the successful response not including the status character.
Throws:
GtpError - containing the response if the command fails.

sendComment

public abstract void sendComment(java.lang.String comment)
Send comment.

Parameters:
comment - comment line (must start with '#').

sendBoardsize

public void sendBoardsize(int size)
                   throws GtpError
Send command for setting the board size. Send the command if it exists in the GTP protocol version. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Throws:
GtpError
See Also:
getCommandBoardsize(int)

sendClearBoard

public void sendClearBoard(int size)
                    throws GtpError
Send command for staring a new game. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Throws:
GtpError
See Also:
getCommandClearBoard(int)

sendPlay

public void sendPlay(Move move)
              throws GtpError
Send command for playing a move. Note: call queryProtocolVersion first

Throws:
GtpError

sendInterrupt

public void sendInterrupt()
                   throws GtpError
Interrupt current command. Can be called from a different thread during a send. Note: call queryInterruptSupport first

Throws:
GtpError - if interrupting commands is not supported.
See Also:
isInterruptSupported()

setLowerCase

public void setLowerCase()
Enable lower case mode for play commands. For engines that don't implement GTP correctly and understand only lower case moves in the play command.

waitForExit

public abstract void waitForExit()
Wait until the process of the program exits. Should do nothing if the concrete class does not create a process.
